snippet: The Common Core, a rigorous education initiative that has been ardently supported by the Obama administration, is opposed by some as an edict and by others as too hard.
abstract: Common Core, rigorous education initiative that has been ardently supported by Obama administration, is opposed by some critics as an edict and by others as too hard; those concerns have been underscored after New York State released results from reading and math exams showing that less than a third of students passed; supporters of new standards say critics are too impatient.
lead_paragraph: The Common Core, a rigorous education initiative that has been ardently supported by the Obama administration, is opposed by some as an edict and by others as too hard.

headline.main: School Standards’ Debut Is Rocky, and Critics Pounce
headline.print_headline: Debut of School Standards Is Rocky, and the Critics Are Pouncing Left and Right
